text: It requires webkit, xvfb (or X) and Qt4, and works best on Ubuntu.
I believe this is what you are looking for:
But what I wanted was some code in javascript or python that would allow me to create an image from a table or div.
If you're not locked to having it as a PNG, you could turn it into a PDF with Pisa/Report Lab (http://www.xhtml2pdf.com/).
There is a service called Webthumb at http://webthumb.bluga.net/home that I have used for something similar.
It has a fairly easy REST interface for you to work upon.
There is a service with the name sitethumbshot.com.
Its pretty good service and easy to integrate.
You can take a look at CutyCapt as well - http://cutycapt.sourceforge.net/
